chunk_id: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0__chunk_689
source: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0
text:
ANY pregnant women CAN develop pre-eclampsia. Those most at risk are antenatal attendees who have at
least one of the features below:
o primigravidae, in particular teenagers
o age 35 years and above
o previous pregnancy complicated by HDP
o previous abruptio placentae or unexplained intra-uterine death
o multiple pregnancies
o medical complications such as chronic hypertension, renal disorders, diabetes, connective tissue
di
sorders or antiphospholipid syndrome
o obesity
o women who develop ed
